column1: This CSV provides information about the species in the NOAA CSL Inventory. There are some oddities that this sheet hopes to address.
Data for the NC files is downloaded from https://csl.noaa.gov/groups/csl7/measurements/2020covid-aqs/emissions/. There are a variety of species in these
NC files that are meant to correspond with one of the SAPRC mechanisms. Colin Harkins of NOAA stated that the naming conventions are more based on SAPRC99 than

column4: and existence of species is not uniform across SAPRC99 and SAPRC22 (most recent). This csv hopefully

column1: NC_name: The name of the species in the NOAA CSL Inventory NC files
Readme_name: This is the mapping of NC_name to an SAPRC name as defined in https://csl.noaa.gov/groups/csl7/measurements/2020covid-aqs/data/emissions/FIVE/README.txt. However
column2: not all these names correspond directly to SAPRC99 species

column1: NC_unit: The unit in the attributes of the NC files for that species
NC_description: The description of the species in the NC files. These seem to match most closely with the SAPRC99 descriptions
Known_MW: If the molecular weight is not in question (such as for trace gasses)
column2: there will be a value here and can be taken as "truth"

column1: SAPRC99_Name: If there is an SAPRC99 species matching the name in the readme (or should obviously be matching based on description)
column2: this is the name of that species in the MechDB.xls

column1: SAPRC99_MW: If there is an SAPRC99 species matching
column2: this is the molecular weight in the MechDB.xls sheet

column1: SAPRC99_Description: If there is an SAPRC99 species matching
column2: this is the description of that species in the MechDB.xls sheet

column1: SAPRC22_Name: If there is an SAPRC22 species matching the name in the readme (or should obviously be matching based on description)
column2: this is the name of that species in the MechDB.xls

column1: SAPRC22_MW: If there is an SAPRC22 species matching
column2: this is the molecular weight in the MechDB.xls sheet

column1: SAPRC22_Description: If there is an SAPRC22 species matching
column2: this is the description of that species in the MechDB.xls sheet

column8: Alkanes and other non-aromatic compounds that react only with OH, and have kOH between 2 and 5 x 102 ppm-1 min-1.  (Primarily ethane)
column11: Saturated compounds that react only with OH, and have kOH between 1.4e-13 and 3.5e-13 cm3 molec-1 s-1

column4: Alkanes with 500<k(OH)<2500 ppm^-1-min^-1 EXCLUDE(C3H8 C2H2 ethanol acids)
column8: Alkanes and other non-aromatic compounds that react only with OH, and have kOH between 5 x 102 and 2.5 x 103 ppm-1 min-1. (Primarily propane and acetylene)
column11: Saturated compounds that have kOH between 3.5e-13 and 1.7e12 cm3 molec-1 s-1

column8: Alkanes and other non-aromatic compounds that react only with OH, and have kOH between 2.5 x 103 and 5 x 103 ppm-1 min-1.
column11: Saturated compounds that and have kOH between 1.7e-12 and 3.5e-12 cm3 molec-1 s-1

column8: Alkanes and other non-aromatic compounds that react only with OH, and have kOH between 5 x 103 and 1 x 104 ppm-1 min-1.
column11: Saturated compounds that and have kOH between 3.5e-12 and 6.0e-12 cm3 molec-1 s-1

column4: Alkanes with k(OH)>10000 ppm^-1-min^-1 EXCLUDE(ethylene glycol)
column8: Alkanes and other non-aromatic compounds that react only with OH, and have kOH greater than 1 x 104 ppm-1 min-1.
column11: Saturated compounds that and have kOH greater than 6.0e-12 cm3 molec-1 s-1 and have fewer than 12 carbons+oxygens.

column8: Alkenes (other than ethene) with kOH < 7x104 ppm-1 min-1.
column11: Alkenes other than ethene with kOH between 8e-12 and 6e-11

column4: Alkenes with k(OH)>20000 ppm^-1-min^-1 EXCLUDE(dienes and styrenes)
column11: Alkenes other than terpenes or 1,3-butadiene that have OH rate constants greater than 6e-12 cm3 molec-1 s-1.
Lumped terpenes (C10H16 and at least one ring and alkene group)

column4: Aromatics with k(OH)<20000 ppm^-1-min^-1 EXCLUDE(benzene and toluene)
column11: Alkylbenzenes that react with kOH between 5e-12 and 1e-11 cm3 molec-1 s-1. Mostly alkylbenzenes with only one substituent
Alkylbenzenes that react with kOH higher than 1e-11 cm3 molec-1 s-1. Mostly alkylbenzenes with more than one substituent
C4+ saturated aldehydes with 9 or fewer carbons

column8: Ketones and other non-aldehyde oxygenated products which react with OH radicals faster than 5 x 10-13 but slower than 5 x 10-12 cm3 molec-2 sec-1.
Ketones and other non-aldehyde oxygenated products which react with OH radicals faster 5 x 10-12 cm3 molec-2 sec-1.

column11: Methyl Glyoxal and other alpha-keto aldehydes

column8: Methyl Vinyl Ketone and unsaturated ketones
